textbooks.title: Principles of Corporate Finance
textbooks.author: Richard Brealey, Stewart Myers, Franklin Allen, Alex Edmans

grading.policies: Regular attendance is essential; excessive absences will result in a failing grade.

assignments.description: ManageMentor Assessments, Problem Sets and Case Write-ups

policies.attendance: Regular Zoom attendance is assumed; excessive absences will result in a failing grade.
policies.late_work: Late submissions will lose points at a rate of 1% per hour.
policies.academic_integrity: All students must adhere to the Graduate Student Code of Academic Integrity.
policies.accommodations: Students with documented disabilities can receive accommodations through the Office of Disability Services.

additional_info.course_format: Live classes on Tuesdays 6:00PM-8:30PM EDT with asynchronous videos and exams.
additional_info.technology_requirements: ManageMentor Module, Microsoft Office 365, and a compatible web browser.
additional_info.support_resources: Office of Counseling and Psychological Services (CAPS) for mental health support.

instructor.name: Prof Kal Vadasz, Prof Igor Gavrilov

_metadata.course_description: The purpose of this course is to introduce techniques of financial analysis, with emphasis on topics in the corporate finance area.
learning_outcomes: Understand the role of Managerial Finance in the business enterprise
Apply the concept of time value of money to evaluate equity and fixed income securities.
Understand the legal and market fundamentals of stocks and bonds.
Understand the difference between debt and equity capital, common and preferred stock, and approaches to common stock valuation.

Develop plans to frame long-term investment decisions that include applying free cash flow analysis, capital budgeting techniques, decision metrics (NPV, EVA, breakeven, IRR, etc.), and risk assessment.
Determine the cost of capital and understand its significance in making long-term investment decisions.
Calculate leverage and understand optimal firm capital structure theories.
Have a basic awareness of how derivatives can serve to reduce risk.
